summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2003 PONTIAC GRAND AM.  THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT WHENEVER THE VEHICLE WAS TURNED OFF, IT WOULD FAIL TO RESTART IMMEDIATELY.  THE FAILURE OCCURRED INTERMITTENTLY AND WITHOUT WARNING.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN DIAGNOSED BY THE DEALER.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 84,000.   UPDATED 08/14/09.  *LJ  THE CONSUMER STATED THE PROBLEM WAS WITHIN THE SECURITY SYSTEM. THE TURN SIGNALS WOULD CLICK WHILE DRIVING. UPDATED 08/14/09.*JB
